N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.57 - Capital lease

State Regulations
(a) A lease which
meets one of the following four criteria: (1)

The present value of the minimum lease payments is 90 percent or more of the
fair value of the property to the lessor. (2)

The lease term is 75 percent or more of
the leased property's estimated economic life. (3)

The lease contains a bargain (less than
fair value) purchase option. (4)

Ownership is transferred to the lessee by the end of the lease term. (b) See FASB Statement No. 13 for
further details. Notes
